curam.util.client.bopi
Interface BOPI

All Superinterfaces:
curam.util.client.bopi.BOPIConstants
All Known Implementing Classes:
TextHelper
public interface BOPI
extends curam.util.client.bopi.BOPIConstants

A Business Operation Presentation Interface defines the interface used by the client infrastructure presentation layer to access a business operation implemented in the application server. This interface is implemented by the TextHelper abstract class and its generated sub-classes.

A BOPI implementation is used to invoke a specific business operation; passing data to the operation, retrieving the result, and handling any remote exceptions. A BOPI is also responsible for the formatting of data before it is presented to a user and the parsing and validation of data entered by a user. All data used on the presentation layer must be in string form, so the management of data conversion is one of the main functions of a BOPI.

A BOPI has a well-defined life-cycle. Some of the life-cycle methods are implemented by the abstract TextHelper class and others by the concrete TextHelper classes generated for each business operation.

When accessing property values by index, constants for the property indexes are generated into each implementation class for a business operation, so literal index values are not necessary or recommended.

Method Detail

callServer

long callServer()
                throws JDEException
Invokes the business operation.

Returns:
The invocation time in milliseconds.
Throws:
JDEException - If the invocation was unsuccessful of there was a failure during property processing.

getUserPreferences

UserPreferences getUserPreferences()
Gets the user preferences object for this BOPI.

Returns:
The user preferences object.

setUserPreferences

void setUserPreferences(UserPreferences userPreferences)
Sets the user preferences object for this BOPI. This can be used by the BOPI to determine the user's locale.

Parameters:
userPreferences - The user preferences object.

getPropertyIndex

int getPropertyIndex(java.lang.String propertyName)
                     throws ClientException
Gets the index of the property with the specified property name. This is a convenience method that may be required if the index is not readily available.

Parameters:
propertyName - The full name of the property.
Returns:
The property index.
Throws:
ClientException - If property name is not recognized.

getLabel

java.lang.String getLabel(int propertyIndex)
Gets the value of the label used in the presentation layer for a property. This value is only available after the submission of form data and the population of the BOPI with the property values entered on the form. If a property does not appear on a form, it will have no label value, so the raw property name will be used instead.

Parameters:
propertyIndex - The property index.
Returns:
The property label value, or the property name if there is no label available.
Throws:
java.lang.ArrayIndexOutOfBoundsException - If the index is invalid.
